extraction_metadata.extraction_method: Deep philosophical analysis with exact citations

josephus_antiquities.topic: Classification of Jewish sects on fate/free will
josephus_antiquities.significance: First systematic classification of Jewish positions on free will

qumran_hodayot.text: Je sais par Ta connaissance que ce n'est pas par la force humaine [...] l'homme n'est [pas] maître de lui-même, et qu'un être humain ne peut régler son destin
qumran_hodayot.continuation: Mais je sais que dans Ta main réside l'inclination de tout esprit [... et toutes] ses [œuvres] Tu les détermines avant même de l'avoir créé
qumran_hodayot.elect: Toi seul as [cré]é le juste et, dès le ventre de sa mère, Tu as décrété qu'il observerait Ton alliance
qumran_hodayot.reprobate: Mais les impies, Tu les as créés pour [le temps de] Ta [c]olère et, dès leur conception, Tu les as réservés pour le jour du massacre
qumran_hodayot.analysis: Strong predestination theology with asymmetric causality

ben_sirah.key_phrase: God and human as two agents totally independent from each other
ben_sirah.girardi_assessment: Ben Sirah can be qualified as libertarian, following the competitive model

barclay_tanner_framework.authors: John M.G. Barclay and Kathryn E. Tanner

models.competitive: God and human as autonomous agents, either/or, inverse proportion
models.inclusive: Human as part of God, compatibilist, Spinozist
models.transcendent: God both transcendent and immanent, direct proportion

sanders_new_perspective.author: E.P. Sanders
sanders_new_perspective.thesis: Covenantal nomism - works don't get you in but keep you in
sanders_new_perspective.qumran_modification: Works not even keeping you in but consequence of election
sanders_new_perspective.girardi_critique: For Qumran there is no merita humana

alfred_marx.quote: On ne trouvera jamais dans un hymne l'insistance sur la libre volonté de l'homme. Mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elle n'existe pas : soli deo gloria!
alfred_marx.context: Warning about genre considerations in Qumran hymns

levi.assessment: Qualifies rabbis as 'Pelagians avant la lettre'
levi.explanation: Judaism of Second Temple period was mostly libertarian
levi.reasons: Strict monotheism rejecting dualism, conception of God's justice, works as theodicy

main_thesis.statement: Paul adopts transcendent compatibilism - third model beyond competitive and inclusive
main_thesis.elaboration: Same action can be attributed to both human and God without competition
main_thesis.biblical_support: Philippians 2:12-13 - God working in believers 'to will and to work'

anthropological_pessimism.jewish_origins: Traceable to Genesis, survived in certain forms of Judaism, reinforced in Paul
anthropological_pessimism.not_neutral: peccatum originale originatum - humans born in state of sin with inclination to evil

asymmetric_causality.principle: God's relationship to good and evil is not the same
asymmetric_causality.qumran_example: Just saved by God's action, unjust condemned by their own works
asymmetric_causality.significance: Key to understanding divine causality in Qumran, Paul, Greek Fathers, and Augustine

against_uniformity.claim: Not one Judaism but 'Judaisms' divided precisely on divine causality and free will
against_uniformity.evidence: Extreme diversity from Qumran determinism to Ben Sirah libertarianism

genre_consideration.warning: Hymns magnify God by lowering humans - be careful drawing doctrinal teachings
genre_consideration.but: Qumran hymns were widely distributed, possibly considered canonical

competitive.description: Two autonomous agents, action attributed to one cannot be to other
competitive.proportion: Inverse - more to God = less to human
competitive.examples: Certain Lutheran positions and Tridentine positions

inclusive.description: Human as part of God, what human does attributed to God
inclusive.free_will: Redefinition not rejection - control necessary for moral responsibility

transcendent.description: God totally transcendent and totally immanent
transcendent.proportion: Direct - more to human = more to God
transcendent.paradox: Human totally dependent yet becomes free by affirming dependence
transcendent.biblical: 1 Cor 15:10 'would make no sense for a libertarian'

christian_doctrine.originatum: All descendants born in state of sin
christian_doctrine.peccability: Not just possibility but inclination to evil

jewish_precursors.not_doctrine: No doctrine of original sin in Genesis
jewish_precursors.but_intuition: Jewish readers could sense postlapsarian change affecting free will

philippians_2_12_13.text: Work out your salvation with fear and trembling, for it is God who works in you to will and to act
philippians_2_12_13.significance: Paradigmatic of transcendent model - both human and divine agency

romans_9_11.girardi_approach: Must be read through lens of divine-human agency models

spurgeon_quote.context: Response to reconciling divine sovereignty and human responsibility
spurgeon_quote.girardi_comment: Modern mind sees these in conflictual terms but nothing shows Paul read them this way

framework_limitations.missing: Other agents (Satan, sons of God, demons, angels, Evil)

diversity_recognition.principle: Must recognize extreme diversity of Second Temple Judaism

second_temple_spectrum.qumran: Strong predestination, human inability, divine determination

christian_reception.tendency: Move toward libertarianism to combat fatalism
